topics.body:
Oh my god I'm getting super excited: I'm not sure if this belongs into the video game thread or what have you.

Do you recognize the character my avatar is from?  Monster girl quest?  Okay; it's getting a sequel and the news that is coming out about the sequel has me squealing in excitement.  The original the problem with it was the gameplay sucked.  The news about Paradox in a nutshell: remember when Final Fantasy was good, now combine it with Fire Emblem.

topics.body:
It turns out the fastest internet is generally agreed to belong to South Korea... more surprising is the rest of the top 5 seems to be dominated by unlikely countries: Romania, Latvia, Bulgaria and Lithuania.

The top ten then consists of Hong Kong, Singapore, Japan, Israel and somewhere else that changes a lot.

None of those are in any particular order as it changes depending on when and who you ask.

Also you can recruit *EVERY* monster including bosses; also there's a couple returning characters.

Even Promestein makes a return.  Sara makes a return as well and is a monster girl.  I'm guessing Ilias is making a return as well as a protagonist.  Story wise it wouldn't make sense for her to be the villain again cause at the end of the original she accepted she was wrong.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e869ce6368723033490100#post_53e869ce6368723033490100
The problem with the original monster girl quest is that it was a visual novel.  They're fixing that with the sequel and making the gameplay actually baller.

For those of you that are going "what is monster girl quest?" I'll summarize it in a nutshell; obvious spoilers [spoiler]You follow Luka; the dumb naive protagonist who doesn't understand that the basis of wars in the world isn't simple black and white as he goes out to defeat the monster lord only to realize the girl he's been denying that he had a crush on is the monster lord.  As you go on with your protagonist that refuses to kill anyone he constantly gets his thick skull neck deep into wars and conflicts between morally gray factions with no real villain for the first two parts.  He solves these conflicts using his thick ass skull metaphorically as a battering ram to ram through these conflicts often times winding up with no winners.  Often times the conflict isn't fully resolved and the groups grudgingly admit defeat with negative feelings towards the opposing group still lasting.[/spoiler]

Basically imagine if you gave a dumb idealist that doesn't understand the wars and such he's getting involved in can't be solved through wishful thinking the fighting ability to win against the opposing groups.

If you can look past the fact that it's visual novel game it's a pretty damn good story.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
